channel.title: BUbreakingSectionTwo
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbreakingSectionTwo, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Members of Congress Grasp for a Stopgap Deal to Avert a Shutdown
item.description: Republicans and Democrats agree they will need a temporary measure to fund the government past Sept. 30, but have yet to come to terms on what it shou...

item.title: President of Northwestern, a School Attacked by the G.O.P., Will Resign
item.description: The university’s president, Michael Schill, said he would step down following months of turbulence, including Trump administration cuts of $790 millio...

item.title: Stripe and Paradigm announce new payments-focused blockchain Tempo
item.description: Led by Paradigm managing partner Matt Huang, Tempo is Big Tech’s first major move into crypto.

item.title: Lose-lose: Even if the Supreme Court strikes down Trump’s tariffs, consumers likely wouldn’t see a dime from refunds
item.description: The Trump administration might balk at paying back the tariffs it’s collected.

item.title: As Trump pushes Supreme Court to uphold his tariffs, he signals trade deals will be defunct if he loses the case: ‘I guess we’d have to unwind them’
item.description: “If we don't win that case, our country is going to suffer so greatly, so greatly,” the president said on Wednesday.

item.title: Authorities raided Streameast’s offices and shut down the largest illegal sports streaming platform that had over 1.6 billion visits in the last year
item.description: The network illegally streamed matches and games from Europe’s Premier League and Champions League, as well as those from the NFL, NBA, and MLB.

item.title: Tariff instability and a break with China is hitting American companies hard, and homegrown manufacturer John Deere is no exception
item.description: Trump’s tariff policies are hitting John Deere’s customers hard.

item.title: After Boat Strike, Rubio Says U.S. Will Help Other Nations “Blow Up” Crime Groups
item.description: The Trump administration aims to carry out more violent strikes against drug cartels, Secretary of State Marco Rubio said as he met with Ecuador’s pre...

item.title: Palestinian Leaders Urge U.S. to End Visa Ban Ahead of Statehood Summit
item.description: When world leaders meet in New York this month, several plan to recognize a Palestinian state, but Palestinian leaders may not be there to revel in th...

item.title: Argentine Authorities Charge Couple With Hiding Nazi-Looted Painting

item.title: Ebola Outbreak Is Declared in Kasai Province of Congo
item.description: Health officials have recorded 28 suspected cases and 15 fatalities so far in the latest outbreak of the deadly virus, which has claimed thousands of ...

item.title: Inside Trump’s Unorthodox Climate Attacks in Courts Nationwide
item.description: The administration is cranking up efforts to kill state laws and legal cases that would force fossil-fuel companies to pay for climate damage.

item.title: Giorgio Armani, Italian Fashion Designer, Dies at 91
item.description: He created a male uniform whose feminized form won favor with women. An alliance with movie stars made his name all but synonymous with red-carpet dre...
